quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Sanford Meisner and Sid Haig
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, portray. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Select the Sanford Meisner quote.

options.text: I regard the theater as the greatest of human art forms, the most immediate way in which a human can share with another the sense of what it is like to be a human.
Acting is the reality of unreality, the illuminating of the unlightable.
Silence has a myriad of meanings. In the theater, silence is the absence of words but not the absence of meaning.
Acting is half shame and half glory. Shame at exhibiting yourself, glory when you can forget yourself.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silence has a myriad of meanings. In the theater, silence is the absence of words but not the absence of meaning.

questions.question: Sanford Meisner was selected as one of the 28 actors in this acting group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Group Theater

questions.question: In 1968 Sid Haig played one of three inbred and murderous siblings in this Jack Hill black comedy- horror film starring Lon Chaney, Jr.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spider Baby

questions.question: This beautiful student of Sanford Meisner was the sister of Olivia DeHaviland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joan Fontaine

questions.question: What character did Winona Ryder portray in the 1990 movie Mermaids?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlotte Flax

questions.question: Which of the following was a student of Sanford Meisner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jon Voight

questions.question: Sanford Meisner said that this was the defining emotional moment in his life.

options.text: He saw Charlie Chaplin performing live in London.
He saw his first movie in the Fairfax area of Los Angeles.
His younger brother died from drinking unpasteurized milk.
He attended his first drama class at Northwestern University.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His younger brother died from drinking unpasteurized milk.

questions.question: What is the title of the 1998 movie directed by Woody Allen in which Winona Ryder portrayed a character called Nola?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Celebrity

questions.question: As a child, Sid Haig grew so quickly that he lost much of his motor coordination, so his parents enrolled him in dancing lessons. At what age did Sid Haig become a paid dancer in vaudeville acts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: Captain Spaulding has become an icon for the New Horror genre. In what 2000 Rob Zombie film did Sid Haig star as this clown-faced sociopath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: House of 1000 Corpses

questions.question: Which statement is true about Sanford Meisner?

options.text: He was born in Los Angeles in 1929 and died in New York City in 2007.
He was born in New York City in 1905 and died in California in 1997.
He was born in London, England in 1931 and  died in New York City in 2001.
He was born in Chicago in 1927 and died in California in 2008.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was born in New York City in 1905 and died in California in 1997.

questions.question: As a young man Sanford Meisner got a job acting as an extra in They Knew What They Wanted, an unimportant play except that this person was the  plays director.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lee Strasberg

questions.question: This student of Sanford Meisner became a famous director and choreographer. The film All That Jazz was a biography of this famous man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Fosse

questions.question: Which statement describes the Meisner Technique?

options.text: Acting begins when the actor is able to use his own lines, not those of the author.
Acting is the ability to attract. An actor is an attractor.
Acting must begin with voice warm-up and concentration techniques.
Acting is the ability to live truthfully under imaginary circumstances.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Acting is the ability to live truthfully under imaginary circumstances.

questions.question: Sid Haig was offered the role of Marsellus Wallace in Quentin Tarantinos Pulp Fiction, but refused the role. Who played Marsellus Wallace in the film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ving Rhames

questions.question: Sid Haigs first acting job was in exploitation director Jack Hills student film The Host. On how many films did Haig and Hill collaborate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: For his role in this 2005 horror film, Sid Haig received the award for Best Actor in the 15th Annual Fangoria Chainsaw Awards. He shared the award for Most Vile Villain at the First Annual Spike TV Scream Awards with Sheri Moon, Leslie Easterbrook and Bill Moseley as The Firefly Family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Devils Rejects

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drugs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Foxy Brown

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Faith Evans

questions.question: Sid Haig was born Sidney Eddy Mosesian in Fresno, California on July 14, 1939. Where did Sid get his stage name from?

options.text: Haig was the last name of his pediatrician.
Haig was his mothers maiden name spelled backwards.
Haig was the last name of his 3rd grade teacher.
Haig was his fathers first name.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haig was his fathers first name.

questions.question: What famous rapper attended the George Westinghouse Information Technology High School together with Notorious B.I.G.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jay-Z

questions.question: In the 1997 Quentin Tarantino movie Jackie Brown, Sid Haig came out of retirement and played the judge. Was this role written specifically for Haig?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: From 1960- 1992, Sid Haig was in almost 350 TV episodes. In which of these TV series did Sig Haig NOT star?

questions.question: What is the name of the debut album released by The Notorious B.I.G in 1994?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ready to Die

questions.question: In 1992 Sid Haig felt he was being typecast and stated, Ill never play another stupid heavy again, and I dont care if that means that I never work, ever. Sid stopped acting and trained in, became licensed in and worked as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hypnotherapist

questions.question: What is the real birth name of rapper The Notorious B.I.G., also known as Biggie Smalls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Wallace

questions.question: Why did rapper The Notorious B.I.G. use a cane when he walked?

options.text: He injured his leg in an accident.
He believed he looked more serious that way.
He was born with a limp.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He injured his leg in an accident.

questions.question: In this 1971George Lucas film, Sid Haig plays the prisoner NCH.

options.text: Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: THX 1138
